questions.question: How many normal modes of vibration will CO<sub>2</sub> have?

explanations.b: Number of normal modes are given by 3N-5 for linear molecules and 3N-6 for non linear molecules where N is the number of atoms.

questions.question: How many vibrational normal modes are present in benzene?

explanations.c: Benzene has 12 atoms and is non-linear, hence 3N-6 gives 30.

questions.question: The vibrational rotational spectrum is observed in …………… region.

explanations.a: Vibrational rotational transition occurs in the near IR region of the spectrum

questions.question: The increase in vibrational energy leads to absorption spectrum in:

explanations.a: Even though the energy of the vibrational energy levels are increased they are quantized and any transition among the vibrational levels will still occur in the IR region.

questions.question: Which of the following is a criteria for a molecule to be IR active?

answers.b: Change in dipole moment in stretching modes

explanations.b: Change in dipole moment during the vibrational stretch causes the molecule to interact with the incoming radiation and hence be IR active
